page.title: 05DALRY(KIRK) HOUSING
page.content: Housing styles are very mixed, varying from traditional houses and cottages over 200 years old,to modern bungalows less than a year. Property is both privately and council owned.Many of the older cottages have been extended with an extra storey at the back, but preserving the original frontage. Every house has its garden and householders take great pride in maintaining them. In 1981 Dalry was voted the best kept Scottish village in 'The Britain in Bloom' competition. The columns of smoke rising from chimneys at dusk testify to the widespread use of coal, peat and wood for heating. Oil, bottled gas and electicity are also used for both heating and cooking. Most households now have cars and street parking is widespread.
